html:
12.17.18  11:58 am   12.16.18  4:30 pm   but in "sometimes(i whatever)" you show us muted short videos that look finished (at least to me). Am I wrong?

     yes

      Did you ever manage to finish those videos?

     some of them, not others

      If so, are you ever going to upload them?

     the finished ones were uploaded along with the regular release schedule at the time

      ((I'm not talking about "beans", since you uploaded that on your song page))

     that's not the same one

12.17.18  11:34 am   5/4 time is basically saying counting to 5 has never been harder. any advice on coping with that?

     let's examine how you ended up in this situation ..... what song is it

12.17.18  11:05 am   What is the next video date?

     i don't know anymore

12.17.18  9:06 am   are you a duck

     no but similar

12.17.18  8:49 am   would you rather capitalize on your content or capitalize your letters

     am i allowed to do both

12.17.18  8:06 am   Have you seen quarks in real life ?

     no but i hope to

12.17.18  7:45 am   When did you decide to make music?

     i don't remember

12.17.18  7:25 am   How are you feeling today?

     bad

12.17.18  3:07 am   Ok you're answering lots of equal temperament questions

     just 1

      so I'll ask another heavily debated music question. What do you tune your A to?

     it seems to me that's not heavily debated ..... 99% of today's music seems to be at a=440, because that's what all music programs are tuned to unless you crawl around in the settings

      Do you take a particular stance in the 440Hz vs 432Hz debate,

     440

      or is there somewhere else you go? Or do you simply not care?

     we are living in a time where there is more agreement about tuning than ever before. because everything's digital, and programs default to 440. most people are pitch correcting their vocals, and it would be 440. even just 30 years ago, things were all over the place because things were on tape, and the speed could get changed either deliberately or not. my decision to stay in tune with the rest of the world is actually mostly out of convenience for other musicians. it happens to be very convenient that almost everything is 440, because if you have an instrument in your hand you can play along with anything. and when that old tape tune comes on that's out of key, you basically can't play to it unless you feel like re-tuning. it may sound fresh to avoid 440, but it doesn't ultimately make a difference, and it is very convenient for all the players out there if i stay in 440

12.17.18  2:37 am   Is social media a general improvement to society or a detriment to how humans act and behave and our effectiveness in life 

     it is yet another avenue for reality to express it's natural ways

12.17.18  2:20 am   I'm sensing strong anti-capitalist messages in your music.

     are you sure

     When should we start the revolution?

     i may have had a slightly different revolution in mind

     you are doing it now

     the best parties can be done in 1 step

12.16.18  6:54 pm   is there any meaning behind got to know whats going on

     yes, the meaning is i would like to know what's going on. and if anyone else would also like to know too, then we both would like to please know what is going on

     earth

     no

     to do audio visual content instead

12.16.18  4:30 pm   will you ever reupload some old videos you've deleted(like "hang me" for example)? If not, why?

     i did not delete that, i never made it

12.16.18  3:30 pm   how do you think of songs? like do you just think "i want to do music but i dont exactly want it to be the same but i want it to be based on something common but i dont and i also ant to do that hysterically"?

     those are all good ways. even better is when the idea finds me and interrupts me when i wasn't looking for it. i've learned to capitalize on that too

12.16.18  3:26 pm   it feels like my music lacks something that everyone else's music has. how do i figure out what is missing in my spice-rack of music? or is it just that i know the in's and out's of my own music, and other people's music just seems better, while to other people, my music sounds absolutely fine?

     theirs may lack something that yours has
